alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 11:02AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Maine, including the following counties, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1059 AM EDT, Gauge reports indicated river levels hovering around minor flood stage. At 13 feet, the Saco River causes minor flooding along River Road in Cornish and downstream in Limington. Some permanent buildings at local campgrounds become isolated. - Water levels are expected to crest today and begin receding with little to no additional rainfall. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cornish, Standish, Limington and Baldwin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
